headline: NBC4 to air Republican U.S. Senate primary debate on March 21
author: Orri Benatar
sentences:
Vance
The location of the debate will be the FOX 8 studio in Cleveland with six Nexstar stations set to telecast the primary debate live:
NBC4 in Columbus
FOX 8 in Cleveland
2 News in Dayton
First News 27 in Youngstown
WTRF TV in Wheeling, W.Va./Steubenville, Ohio
WOWK TV in Charleston, W.Va./southeast Ohio
The U.S. Senate candidates are vying for the seat of incumbent U.S.
COLUMBUS, Ohio (WCMH) — NBC4 anchor Colleen Marshall and FOX 8 anchor Joe Toohey will moderate a debate featuring Ohio’s Republican candidates for U.S. Senate that will air live on March 21.
The live telecast will be broadcast on Nexstar-owned Ohio stations from 7 to 8 p.m. and will feature five of the Republican candidates running for U.S. Senate.
NBC4 has made the same offer for a debate to the Democratic candidates for Senate in Ohio and presently, not enough candidates have qualified to take part.
The Republican and Democratic primary is scheduled for May 3 and the general election will be on November 8.

Debate participants will include:
Matt Dolan
Mike Gibbons
Josh Mandel
Jane Timken
J.D.
Senator Rob Portman who announced he would not seek re-election.
